vision.notes: Casuariidae are birds, and thus possess vision. Given their diurnal activity, vision is likely important for foraging and predator avoidance.

audition.notes: As birds, Casuariidae possess hearing. Likely used for communication and predator detection.

olfaction.notes: Olfactory capabilities in ratites are not well-documented in the provided context. Further research is needed to determine the prevalence and importance of olfaction in this family.

somatosensation.notes: Birds have tactile receptors for sensing touch, pressure, and temperature. Important for interacting with the environment.

magnetoreception.notes: Some birds are known to have magnetoreception abilities for navigation. It is unknown if Casuariidae possess this sense.
